185942129.review:
"The Room" ist ein Meisterwerk des Puzzle-Genres, das Spieler mit seiner einzigartigen Mischung aus atemberaubender Grafik, immersiver Atmosphäre und cleveren Rätseln in seinen Bann zieht. Entwickelt von Fireproof Games, bietet dieses Spiel eine fesselnde Spielerfahrung, die von der ersten Sekunde an begeistert.

Atmosphäre und GrafikDie visuelle Gestaltung von "The Room" ist beeindruckend detailreich und sorgt für eine dichte, geheimnisvolle Stimmung. Die präzise animierten Objekte, die subtilen Licht- und Schatteneffekte sowie die raffinierte Soundkulisse tragen dazu bei, eine nahezu greifbare Spannung zu erzeugen. Jeder neue Raum, jede neue Schachtel birgt faszinierende Geheimnisse, die es zu entschlüsseln gilt.

Gameplay und RätselDas Herzstück des Spiels sind die intelligent designten Rätsel, die von einfacher Mechanik bis hin zu komplexen logischen Herausforderungen reichen. "The Room" führt den Spieler sanft in seine Mechaniken ein, während die Rätsel kontinuierlich an Tiefe und Komplexität gewinnen. Jeder Fortschritt fühlt sich wie eine echte Errungenschaft an, und die Kombination aus Tüfteln, Entdecken und Logik sorgt für stundenlangen Spielspaß.

Steuerung und BenutzerfreundlichkeitDie intuitive Touch-Steuerung ist ein weiteres Highlight. Durch Wischen, Tippen und Ziehen kann man mit Objekten interagieren, sie drehen, untersuchen und manipulieren. Die Steuerung ist präzise und trägt wesentlich zum immersiven Erlebnis bei.

Story und ImmersionObwohl "The Room" primär ein Puzzle-Spiel ist, bietet es eine geheimnisvolle und dichte Story, die durch kryptische Notizen und versteckte Hinweise erzählt wird. Die dunkle, mysteriöse Geschichte entfaltet sich langsam und motiviert zum Weiterspielen.

Fazit"The Room" ist ein absolutes Muss für alle Rätsel-Fans. Mit seiner atmosphärischen Gestaltung, herausfordernden Rätseln und intuitiven Steuerung bietet es eine unvergessliche Spielerfahrung. Ob man sich auf die Suche nach verborgenen Mechanismen macht oder die tiefere Geschichte entschlüsseln will, dieses Spiel sorgt für spannende Unterhaltung und lässt einen nicht mehr los.

185828984.review:
Was looking for Backroom games when I found this. 
TL:DR, An unexpectedly fun, well designed and presented puzzle game for a great price.

Two things I want to point out that are pretty important I feel in games like this.
First puzzles are focused, in that all the information you need to solve the puzzle is in front of you.  There's no hiding clues behind something behind the camera or off to the side, or in another room.  The puzzle and solution are always in front of you, which helped with some trickier moments.  Also this is subjective but it felt like the puzzle difficulty was mostly medium to easy, I actually thought some puzzles might be harder, but the solutions turned out to be simpler, which was fine.  This is most true of the first tutorial puzzle which actually had me stumped because I kept looking for a more complex solution or more clues when the solution was quiet simple.

The second is that once you've completed a puzzle it will 'lock' or put itself away, so you always know what you still have to work on and what is solved, which helped because, there can be several open puzzles and clues happening at the same time.  Which helped because I had halted progress until I realised a component of a puzzle was still interact-able and hadn't been solved yet.  Another aside I liked and is kind of related, when you discover something that solves another component or opens something, the camera will focus on what has changed, so you know where and when progress is happening.

185803989.review:
One of the top puzzle games of all time. 
Sure its not free moving like portal/manifold garden/Quern/obduction/Talos Principle....so on 

Its a click around like the Myst games, besides URU. (But better graphics obviously) 
None the less it is perfect because of its simplicity. Take a few hours to solve beautiful puzzle boxes, that's all the game is and I love it. Sure its got some sort of story to follow, but you won't really care about it and you don't have to. Its simple, enjoyable, doesn't try to be anything else and what it does give you is well done. 10/10 for not trying to be extra and making what you got work. Also the sound effect (click click clonk bang rattle) very satisfying. 

Its well worth the very reasonable price and even when you finish playing them all just let it sit for a few years then one day you will see it in your library, remember how much you enjoyed it and think, "well shit I should play it again now that I have forgotten enough of it."

185665592.review:
[h1] The Room [/h1]
Es un juego de puzzles, este busca que pienses detenidamente y revises cada rincon de las recamaras, la jugabilidad es simple y los puzzles van aumentando su dificultad a medida que avanzas, pero no a tal punto de estresarte, todo se hace con el mouse así que no es que haya mucho que destacar, en cuanto a mecánicas.

[h2] Observaciones [/h2]
[h3] Gameplay [/h3]
Como ya dije es simple, usas el mouse y la lente que te dan para ver cosas ocultas, no hay mucho misterio, por lo general es simplemente observar detalladamente y mover piezas, obviamente pensando, ya que a lo loco no lograras mucho.

[h3] Dificultad [/h3]
Progresiva, a medida que avanzas por cada sala los puzzles de habitación serán o mas complejos o mas largos, hay que tener en cuenta que en si, cada habitación es un único puzzle, que tiene secciones, te obliga a hacer el uso del lente, ademas de en ocaciones tener en cuenta lo que dicen algunas notas, y ponerle un poco de lógica, sin embargo en algunos casos los puzzles seccionales pueden ser absurda mente mas simples que en un nivel anterior, así que la dificulta la podemos comparar como una maquina de pulsos, sube y baja, de manera constante, es una forma curiosa de no estresar  al jugador, y eso tiene su merito.

[h3] Tienes miedo de quedarte atascado? [/h3]
No te preocupes, el juego tiene un sistema de pistas que te ayudaran a no quedarte atascado, eso si, las pistas no te trataran como si tuvieras una deficiencia mental, no te darán todo en la boca, aun con la pista deberás interpretarla, para dar con la solución, pero créeme, no es complicado, te lo dice alguien que no puede concentrarse fácilmente en una sola cosa.

[h3] Gráficos [/h3]
Son lindos, no diré que son lo uff, RTX y ray tracing, pero son lindos, así que no te pongas mamón con esas cosas, vienes por los puzzles no por los gráficos.

[h3] Sonido [/h3]
Puede ser relajante, o incluso hacerte sentir como que alguien te observa desde la oscuridad, en ese aspecto el sonido ambiental es muy bueno, porque a pesar de ser de puzzles, puede darte algo de repeluz en ocaciones. 

[h1] Conclusión [/h1]
The room es un juego de puzzles accesible, que no trata como idiotas a sus jugadores y tiene una curva de dificultad variable, mas no en constante ascenso, muy recomendable, sobre todo para los caza logros, no es complicado sacarlo y su duración no es mucha, es ideal comprar en rebajas la colección completa, para que tengan muchas horas para pensar por si mismos, y sentirse inteligentes, créeme vale la pena.

185206779.review:
As the first game of the series, it really is a wonderful game.

It is visually beautiful with intricate details and a cleverness that makes you feel smart when you manage to complete the puzzles. The game's story-line has enough mystery that it lure you in, especially if you're the type of person who loves a good mystery. Although it doesn't delve too deep into the background story, it sets it up perfectly for the second game of the series.

The puzzles were not too simple, and not too complex, but rather a perfect average that makes it ideal for a new player to these kind of games.

I really enjoyed this game and felt that if anything, it was too short because I never wanted it to end. Also, the next games of the series get better and better; it really is a beautifully designed game, and I truly love them all.

185171190.review: A great puzzle game, with awesome details & even a story.

184858312.review:
If you're a fan of atmospheric puzzle games that draw you in from the very first moment, The Room is a must-play. As someone who loves to immerse themselves in captivating environments, I can confidently say this game does an exceptional job of drawing you into its mysterious world.

The story begins with an enigmatic box, and you quickly find yourself unraveling its secrets, only to discover that it’s part of a larger puzzle. As you progress through each level, the narrative slowly unfolds, revealing deeper layers of mystery and intrigue. The sense of discovery never stops—every puzzle you solve leads to another, and each new piece of the story makes you more invested in finding out what’s next. It’s a story that feels more like a journey of exploration and curiosity, drawing you deeper into its web with each passing chapter. The more you solve, the more questions arise, and it keeps you glued to the screen, eager to see what lies beyond the next puzzle.

One of the most striking aspects of The Room is its unique and original concept. Instead of traditional puzzle mechanics, the game revolves around tactile, intricate objects that you interact with in a highly detailed environment. The puzzles aren’t just about solving problems—they’re about physically manipulating the objects around you, engaging with the world in a way that feels fresh and innovative. It’s a concept that stands out in a sea of more conventional puzzle games, and its originality is one of the reasons the game is so compelling.

The atmosphere is simply well crafted. You're plunged into a world filled with intricate details and a sense of eerie wonder. The dim lighting and subtle design choices keep you on edge, and it feels like there’s always something hidden just around the corner. The environment itself is almost like another character – one that you're constantly trying to decipher.

The sound design in The Room is equally fits. The music and ambient sounds seamlessly match the mysterious tone of the game, enhancing the overall experience without overwhelming it. The sound effects, especially when interacting with objects or solving puzzles, feel satisfyingly precise and add to the immersion.

When it comes to the puzzles, they strike the perfect balance. I found them neither too easy nor frustratingly difficult. The game provides just enough challenge to make you feel accomplished once you solve something, but never leaves you banging your head against a wall for too long. It’s a rewarding experience that keeps you coming back for more.

The hint system is another highlight. It’s not overly hand-holding, which I really appreciate. Instead of just giving you the solution, the hints nudge you in the right direction, helping you stay engaged without spoiling the fun. This kept me invested in figuring things out for myself while still offering enough guidance to ensure I wasn’t ever completely lost.

Overall, The Room is a game that I can wholeheartedly recommend. Its perfect combination of atmosphere, puzzle design, and sound creates a captivating experience that I thoroughly enjoyed from start to finish. Whether you’re a puzzle enthusiast or just looking for something intriguing, this game will not disappoint. Each new level brings even more immersion, and it’s hard to stop playing once you’ve started. The deeper you go, the more you’ll find yourself invested in both the puzzles and the unfolding mystery.

184772398.review:
[h1] Surpreendentemente bom!!! [/h1]

A franquia The Room possui ao todo 4 jogos (para PC e mobile) além de um jogo VR, e todos são surpreendentemente bons! Os jogos giram em torno da resolução de puzzles, muitas das vezes através de puzzles boxes (muito bem feitas e criativas por sinal) dentre outros quebra-cabeças. Ambos os jogos possuem boa variedade de puzzles, boa trilha sonora e uma história de fundo intrigante/interessante que te instigam a continuar. A duração dos jogos vai de 2,5 à 5 horas dependendo do jogo e da sua velocidade de resolução dos quebra-cabeças; o que torna a experiência agradável e não a torna maçante. Vale a pena demais, especialmente quando em promoção. Recomendo toda a série!

184750363.review: Un'esperienza di gioco che mescola perfettamente mistero e puzzle, in cui la sensazione di scoperta è continua e ogni piccolo progresso nella risoluzione degli enigmi risulta estremamente soddisfacente. La curva di difficoltà è ben bilanciata, ogni puzzle mi ha mantenuto costantemente impegnato senza mai risultare frustrante. La grafica incredibilmente dettagliata, così come gli effetti sonori perfettamente curati, hanno contribuito a creare un'esperienza che, pur essendo poco longeva, mi ha sorpreso positivamente.

Un jeu de puzzle au concept simple mais très agréable : des objets casse-tête avec des boutons cachés, chaque aspect de ces objets doit être examiné pour avancer. 

Pour le prix je conseille la collection, qui prolonge l'expérience et présente des nouvelles mécaniques de gameplay et une petite histoire à chaque opus.

184720457.review: The Room is a puzzle game where we find ourselves trying to solve increasingly intricate puzzles by unlocking boxes, finding hidden compartments, and activating devices. The environment is visually stunning, detailed, and immersive. The narrative is mysterious, with only bits and pieces being uncovered at a time. The sounds are crisp and music, while limited, creates ambient tension. This game is short but offers a thought-provoking and atmospheric puzzle experience.

184581058.review:
This game requires you to ask yourself some serious questions in life.
Q.1 Do you like puzzles?
Q.2 Do you like puzzles inside puzzles?
Q.3 Do you like puzzles inside puzzles inside a puzzle?
Q.4 Do you like puzzles inside puzzles inside a puzzle but reveals another puzzle?
Q.5 Do you like puzzles inside puzzles inside a puzzle but reveals another puzzle that takes you to another puzzle?
Q.6 Do you want your brain to melt?

if you answered yes to any of those questions, buy this game.
10/10 would melt my brain again

Super casse tête, j'avais adoré Boxes et j'étais en recherche d'un équivalent. On peut dire que j'ai trouvé son inspiration qui est encore mieux la "copie". Pour les fans d'escape game, et d'ambiance mysthèrieuse, The Room est vraiment la référence!

184413991.review:
First played The Room 1 back in 2015 on my phone. It was such a gem, then they released the successive games in the room series. I have been playing this since I was young and grew with this game. For puzzle and lovevraftian aesthetic lovers, this series was made specially for you. I strongly recommend you play all the games in the series. This game never gets old and I can play over and over again still with the same awe and enjoyment. I cannot highlight enough how much I love The Room series.

The game itself has a well thought of design and the lovevraftian touch for the lore made it unique from any other puzzle and mechanisms games. The graphics and music are very immersive too. The eyepiece is a very innovative addition to this game that again, is unique to the series and presents as a doorway from your casual puzzles and mechanisms games to the mysticism that this game presents.

The Room 1: 10/10

184265857.review:
For the low price of $1.05AUD, I can't say its not worth it for how short it is.

From the Steam Deck, it used an awkward control scheme. Awkward because this game was clearly designed with a mouse in mind, yet the layout selected used ZL, ZR, and the touchpad, but not the touchpad's own button. But passable because it didn't feel bad.
The game was also not as responsive as I would have liked to certain button presses. This game's main gimmick is the lens changing how you see things or reveals hidden things. Sometimes I would click it and it wouldn't register. Other times I would click to take it off and it responded by taking it off and immediately putting it back on. So buyer beware that this is not optimal for Steam Deck just because its verified.

I didn't like how one puzzle as well is clearly visible but you can't touch it until you complete the chapter before it. Like why show it at all if you cannot interact with it? Nor did I like how there were instances of literally not being able to see something because of the shadows cast on the item you're examining. It made for good atmosphere but that was frustrating to find out I couldn't find something because I literally could not see it due to the really well designed shadows.
Those are some minor critiques, but worth pointing out because game design is important for enjoyment, and if you get easily frustrated or are just not in a good enough mood, these kinds of things really dampen your experience of the game. Don't buy it if you're aware you're one of these people.

But I had a lot of fun with it. Its a short, to the point, puzzle game. I'd recommend it if you like puzzle games and escape room style games.

184166241.review:
The Room no es solo un juego de puzzles; es una experiencia artística que combina diseño, narrativa y jugabilidad de manera ejemplar. Su capacidad para involucrar al jugador, estimular su intelecto y mantener su interés lo convierte en un referente dentro de su género.

Recomendado tanto para aficionados a los puzzles como para aquellos que buscan una experiencia de juego única, The Room es una obra que trasciende las expectativas y deja una impresión duradera. Un verdadero imprescindible en la biblioteca de cualquier amante de los videojuegos.

Overall it was fun with some frustration which was to be expected and is not a knock against the game . 184000949.review: This is a fun, short game that will appeal to puzzle lovers. The puzzles are just difficult enough to be challenging without being overly frustrating (although there are a couple I had to look up because there was no way to logic through them}. I also appreciated the complete lack of a superimposed story, which is so often just a fluffy time-waster in puzzle-driven games. No plot, just puzzles. The Room is a fairly easy game. It does not take long to complete (100%). There are a few complicated puzzles on the way and a very rich story which can be hard to understand (also if u get stuck there are were helpful hints). 

I very much recommend buying this game (on sale its a very good deal). It was a lot of fun and in the end it gives the feeling of satisfaction and accomplishment.

183985658.review:
[h1]If you actually enjoy thinking and coming up with a solution, this game is not for you.[/h1]
I've finished Lucas Pope's Return of the Obra Dinn twice, and have been craving for a good puzzle game. I've heard tons of great things about The Room and it was on a significant sale. Overwhelming positive reviews. Clearly they did something right!

This isn't a puzzle game. This is an artistic showcase. This is a very beautiful artistic showcase. I may find a way to chock up some more cash directly to the Artists who made these models and animations and made everything so god damn gorgeous. Art is 10/10. 

Story is 5/10 - there's a decent overused "Alchemy" story being used here, it's got some nice subtle lore drops during the puzzle, nothing intrusive while still having enough of a hook to keep me curious; so it earns itself a 5 or higher. But it's not immersive, it's not original, and it has no purpose. The story could've been about some "toy maker" just asking you to test his puzzle boxes and it'd have been the same game. None of the puzzles relate to Alchemy at all. 

And finally, the puzzles. 2/10 - my intellect was never challenged or provoked. This wasn't a game about figuring something out. This wasn't a game about deducing information or calculating a path. This game considers "discovering an object" to be a puzzle, not figuring out a solution. A good puzzle game doesn't force you to click on some arbitrary, non-descriptive symmetrical element of the box to unlock something. Obra Dinn tells you all of the possible names and causes of death; hell it tells you exactly the last memory you saw someone. You have to figure out what happened, but all of the discovery is done for you, not the deduction. Rise of the Golden Idol is similar. It literally tells you what to click on and gives you 35+ words to use, but you have to form the sentences to deduce what is happening in the scene. The discovery is done for you, not the deduction. 

The Room instead decides to call "Find The Object" and "Find The Spot For Object" as a puzzle. No brain power used. Just randomly clicking on parts of the box incase it just spits out a key (or whatever) for absolutely no reason. Thank god I didn't pay 5$ for this game and I pray that all funds for this game go to the artists only.

183854448.review:
More neutral than not recommended, but Steam doesn't have that option.

I love puzzle adventure games and hidden object games, but this one just didn't do it for me. The 3D camera controls were awkward for me, and it was a little disappointing to spend the whole game just circling a table.

The puzzles themselves were hit and miss, with more emphasis on miss for me. When the puzzles have clues, I found them to be pretty obvious to solve. However, there were several puzzles that seemed to be practically brute force or just tinker with it until you open it. There were also a few times that I felt the UI did not make it clear that an object could be interacted or manipulated with, which is a pretty frustrating reason to use a hint.

It's no Myst, but you can do a lot worse for $1 (during winter sale). (And it's no Uru either, thank god.)

183829314.review: I thought this was a very good puzzle game! I thought the visuals and music, while nothing spectacular, were good, and fit the game quite well. The puzzles themselves I did not find difficult or super memorable, but they were also far from bad. They would be challenging enough for a new puzzle game player, but this game doesn't offer too much challenge for seasoned puzzle game players. This game does do one thing spectacularly, however. The story and the mysteries surrounding it. This game makes its narrative so intriguing, you want to solve more puzzles so you can learn more about the mysteries it holds. There is so much left with the story that they could explore and talk about, and there are several sequels that I hope will do exactly that. But for a first entry into a series, this game is worthy of your time and money.

183608429.review: Simplesmente muito bom! gameplay tranquila e os puzzles são desafiadores na medida certa

183605176.review: Good game. I appreciated that there was no travel between areas like in hidden object games I've played in the past. Each part of the story is right in front of you and you just need to solve it. It was challenging enough that I enjoyed myself, but did not need hints. It is fun to play with a friend. Two minds are better than one!

183595144.review: This is one of the best puzzle solving games I've played in a long time..  5 stars...

183579735.review: Fun little game, there are moments where you are stuck and unsure what to do but often with a good look around you end up unstuck very quickly and it's usually something very obvious. It never felt frustrating like some puzzle games can be.

183568318.review: Kurz und knackig. Würde ich nochmal spielen

183536546.review: It's a fun puzzle game that captivates you into using your brain and think for a few hours. It's not that hard but it also doesn't just give puzzles you'll immediately figure out.

183534788.review:
Por conta que ele é inteiramente baseado em enigmas/quebra-cabeças você pode estar com medo de ele ser chato, mas confia em mim, ele não é. Pois os quebra-cabeças não são tão fáceis a ponto de serem entediantes e nem tão difíceis a ponto de você simplesmente não conseguir passar de uma parte. Ele também te deixa muito imerso e focado com as musicas e efeitos sonoros dele que casam perfeitamente com a "vibe visual" do jogo, oque deixa ele muito mais "gostável" até mesmo pra pessoas que não curtem muito esse tipo de jogo.
  Ele é curtinho, da pra terminar em um dia de boas, mas mesmo assim vale a pena, pois nem é tão caro principalmente se tiver em promoção (comprei por 2 reais).
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
OBS: se tu gosta de dificuldade rlx que esse jogo tem umas hora que tu quebra a cabeça dms nele

183528124.review: É um escape incrível, com muitos mecanismos e itens, com uma dificuldade mediana, perfeito para aqueles que são novos no mundo dos escapes e querem se aprofundar neste mundo maravilhoso. Ele procura trazer mais dificuldade não por meio de salas grandes e cheias de itens, mas por coisas geralmente menores e mais complexas, requirindo mais atenção e concentração. E, para aqueles que se enrolarem e se confundirem, há dicas que aparecem no canto superior esquerdo da tela, de tempos em tempos, se o jogo perceber que o jogador não está progredindo, ele (o jogo) dá uma dica. Enfim, o jogo é PERFEITO, super recomendo!

183520579.review: I played the first game in The Room over ten years ago. So glad to have found the bundle on Steam (now I can complete the series). The game still looks beautiful after all these years and the puzzles are the most creative I've ever played. You won't be bored playing this game.
